intro: Acioa mannii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are often used in ornamental gardening. Acioa mannii thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth.
